title: Grayscale Files for Crypto ETF ‚Äì Will the SEC Approve?
body: The post Grayscale Files for Crypto ETF ‚Äì Will the SEC Approve? appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News Grayscale has officially filed an S-3 form with the U.S. SEC to register its Digital Large Cap Fund as an exchange-traded fund (ETF). This fund holds major cryptocurrencies, including Bitcoin, Ethereum, XRP, Solana, and Cardano. If approved, the ETF could open the door for greater institutional investment in crypto, making regulated exposure easier for big players. While regulatory approval is still pending, this move marks another step toward mainstream crypto adoption in traditional finance.

title: Kentucky Drops Crypto Staking Lawsuit Against Coinbase, Joining Vermont & South Carolina
body: Kentucky has officially dismissed its lawsuit against Coinbase over the exchange‚Äôs staking services, becoming the third U.S. state in recent months to roll back legal action against the company. The Kentucky Department of Financial Institutions filed a joint stipulation of dismissal on March 31, ending its case against Coinbase for offering unregistered securities through its staking program. Source: ctfassets.net This follows a growing trend of state-level regulatory reversals. Vermont withdrew its lawsuit against Coinbase on March 14 , citing the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission‚Äôs (SEC) own decision to drop its federal case in February. South Carolina quickly followed suit , dismissing its case on March 27 after local users reportedly lost around $2 million in staking rewards due to the ban. Paul Grewal, Coinbase‚Äôs Chief Legal Officer, responded to Kentucky‚Äôs move on social media, urging Congress to implement a unified federal market structure for crypto. @GovAndyBeshear ‚Äôs Department of Financial Institutions has followed suit by dismissing Kentucky's staking lawsuit against @coinbase ‚Äî just as Vermont and South Carolina recently did. Congress needs to end this litigation-driven, state-by-state approach with a federal market‚Ä¶ https://t.co/LyCy2iLS20 ‚Äî paulgrewal.eth (@iampaulgrewal) March 31, 2025 He also pointed out bipartisan agreement within Kentucky that staking and mining should not be classified as securities. While three states have now reversed their stance, seven others, including California, New Jersey, Illinois, Washington, Alabama, Maryland, and Wisconsin, still have pending legal actions against Coinbase. Kentucky‚Äôs Bitcoin Rights Bill Kentucky‚Äôs decision to drop the lawsuit against Coinbase aligns closely with its recent legislative push toward pro-crypto policies. Just days before the case was dismissed, Governor Andy Beshear signed House Bill 701, also known as the ‚ÄúBitcoin Rights‚Äù bill , into law. Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear has officially signed House Bill 701, known as the ‚ÄúBitcoin Rights‚Äù bill, into law. #Kentucky #Bitcoin https://t.co/YQjxgcHiEV ‚Äî Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) March 25, 2025 This bill, which passed unanimously in both the House and Senate, provides significant protections for crypto users and businesses in the state. Among its key provisions, HB701 enshrines the right for individuals to self-custody digital assets, run blockchain nodes, and conduct transactions without the threat of discriminatory regulation. Additionally, the bill shields mining operations from restrictive zoning laws and prevents crypto staking from being classified as a securities offering. Kentucky is also considering another bill that would allow the State Investment Commission to allocate up to 10% of the state‚Äôs excess reserves into Bitcoin and other digital assets. This move would position Kentucky alongside states like Oklahoma, Missouri , and Arizona , which are exploring similar crypto investment strategies. Oklahoma, for instance, recently advanced its Strategic Bitcoin Reserve Act (HB 1203) , which authorizes state investment in Bitcoin. Oklahoma moves closer to Bitcoin adoption with the Strategic Bitcoin Reserve Act approval. #Oklahoma #Bitcoin https://t.co/8uMp7IYMrD ‚Äî Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) February 26, 2025 Missouri and Arizona have also introduced bills that seek to establish digital asset reserves, reflecting a growing nationwide trend of state-level crypto adoption. Broader Implications for U.S. Crypto Regulation Kentucky‚Äôs dismissal of the lawsuit and the passage of its Bitcoin Rights bill are part of a larger shift in how states approach crypto regulation. The move shows increasing resistance to the SEC‚Äôs aggressive enforcement tactics, with multiple states opting instead for legislative clarity rather than punitive actions against crypto firms. The trend began with the SEC‚Äôs voluntary dismissal of its lawsuit against Coinbase in February . The @SECGov plans to drop its enforcement case against @coinbase , with CEO @brian_armstrong calling a "huge day" for crypto. #Coinbase #SEC https://t.co/8Q5mkqG1J8 ‚Äî Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) February 21, 2025 Vermont and South Carolina quickly followed suit, dropping their cases against Coinbase and further weakening the regulatory assault on staking services. South Carolina‚Äôs decision to drop its case coincided with the introduction of the Strategic Digital Assets Reserve Act, which proposes that the state allocate up to 10% of certain funds into cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin. This bill, filed by Rep. Jordan Pace, authorizes the state treasurer to hold up to one million BTC in reserves, marking a significant step toward state-level crypto adoption. With several state legislatures now actively considering bills to integrate Bitcoin into their financial strategies, the legal battles against Coinbase and similar companies may continue to weaken in favor of clearer, more structured crypto regulations at both state and federal levels. The post Kentucky Drops Crypto Staking Lawsuit Against Coinbase, Joining Vermont & South Carolina appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: Bitcoin Is Being Propped Up And Looks Destined To Collapse
body: Summary Bitcoin and most cryptocurrencies are nearly worthless, with extreme volatility and speculative nature, making them unsuitable for value investing. Despite high market capitalization, Bitcoin has zero intrinsic value, and declining transaction volumes and active addresses indicate waning adoption. Comparisons to precious metals are flawed; cryptocurrencies lack tangible value and diverse applications, being primarily used for speculation. The current data suggests Bitcoin is a bubble propped up by fewer users, leading me to reaffirm a 'strong sell' rating. Those who follow my work closely know that I am no fan of cryptocurrency. My own professional opinion is that most cryptocurrencies, including Bitcoin ( BTC-USD) , are very nearly worthless. Over the years, the markets have disagreed with me. But it's not uncommon for markets to behave irrationally, sometimes for many years. Those who have speculated on Bitcoin specifically moving higher have been well rewarded. Back in December of last year, Bitcoin hit an all-time high price of over $109,000. It has since fallen to $87,543. But in all fairness, markets in general have taken a beating, especially almost anything related to the technology space. Cryptocurrency has been particularly volatile during its lifetime, with prices soaring and plummeting from time to time. As I have made clear in previous articles, such as here and here , I don't know what the future holds for Bitcoin. In the near term, we very well could see significantly higher prices than what we have seen in the past. For those who like to gamble instead of invest, this can be a very profitable thing to focus on. The value investor in me, however, eschews from this. And while this might mean that I could be wrong in the near term, I maintain my view that Bitcoin only deserves, and may always deserve, a ‚Äòstrong sell‚Äô rating. A bubble being propped up There is no doubt that cryptocurrency is currently being valued by the world rather highly. As of this writing, Bitcoin itself is being priced at about $1.73 trillion. When you add all other cryptocurrencies into the mix, this collective price shoots up to $2.86 trillion. Frankly, I find this to be outrageous. It has zero intrinsic value and it produces nothing. It does, admittedly, have some utility as a medium of exchange. But as Warren Buffett indicated, the market is valuing the check that the money is being delivered with, and nothing more. In his own words : ‚ÄúBitcoin has no unique value at all. It doesn‚Äôt produce anything. You can stare at it all day and no little Bitcoins come out or anything like that. It‚Äôs a delusion, basically... If you had bought gold at the time of Christ and you figure the compound rate on it, you know, it may be a couple tenths of a percent. It basically is not going to deliver anything other than a supposed scare out of people. I‚Äôll tear off a button here. What I have here is a little token... I‚Äôll offer it to you for $1,000, and I‚Äôll see if I can get the price up to $2,000 by the end of the day... But the thing is, it‚Äôs not investing.‚Äù He continued with: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs like a check: it‚Äôs a very effective way of transmitting money and you can do it anonymously and all that. A check is not worth a whole lot of money just because it can do that. I hope Bitcoin becomes a better way to do it, but you can replicate it a bunch of different ways. The idea that it has some huge intrinsic value is just a joke in my view.‚Äù To put in perspective the sheer enormity of the market capitalization of all cryptocurrencies, consider that if this price stood as the equivalent to a nation's GDP, it would make cryptocurrency as a whole larger than the 8th largest country on the planet. It would sandwich it between France and Italy , with the latter being smaller, with GDP for this year being forecasted by the IMF of $2.46 trillion. It's crazy to think that a digital ‚Äòcurrency‚Äô with no underlying asset to back it is considered to be worth more than the entire annual economic output of the 59 million people that currently reside in Italy. Ultimately, I believe that when the history of this era is written, economic historians will view cryptocurrency as perhaps the largest bubble the world has ever known. Data by YCharts [object HTMLElement] At this time, cracks do appear to be forming in the bullish narrative. In the chart above, you can see the price that Bitcoin has traded at over the past few years. Recently, we have seen a downturn. But as I mentioned earlier in this article, extreme volatility in this space is not unheard of. The cracks that I speak of focus on deeper matters. As an example, we need only look at the chart below. In it, you can see a blue line and green bars. The blue line represents the US dollar value of all Bitcoin transactions each month from March 2020 through February 2025. Author - Data from Bitcoin City After plunging in 2021, volume seemed to be declining. However, it has seen a resurgence since then. Those looking only at that data might think that the worst is over. However, the total volume of Bitcoins being traded has continued to drop. In fact, the green bars that show this show a very clear trend of ever lower volume. This indicates to me that something is awry. Keep in mind that the entire narrative that the bulls in the space promote centers around the idea of this being the currency of the future. It's all about adoption and becoming a self-fulfilling prophecy. It is true that if Bitcoin or cryptocurrency in general becomes accepted by the masses, it could very well remain relevant for the foreseeable future. But you don't see declining volumes and growing acceptance occur simultaneously. Author - Data from Glassnode Studio This is not the only data that I have in my arsenal. If you look at the table above and the chart below, you will see monthly data for the last five years that details out the number of active addresses in the space. Active addresses are unique wallet addresses that are involved in transactions using blockchain technology over a span of time. A wallet is considered to have an active address if it either sends cryptocurrency or receives cryptocurrency in that timeframe. Again, if this was a technology that is on its way to mass market acceptance, you would expect the number of active addresses to increase. But the exact opposite is happening. Author - Data from Glassnode Studio In 2024, the number of active addresses was lower than it had been in previous years. In fact, if we average this data out, the average number of active addresses in 2024 came out to 14.44 million. That's 19.8% lower than the 18 million averaged during 2023. In fact, it's lower than any of the other years that I looked at dating back to 2020. We do also have data for January 2025. The 14.19 million active addresses experienced during that month ended up being 21% lower than what was achieved in January 2024. As the second chart below illustrates, it is also substantially lower than any January of the last six years. Author - Data from Glassnode Studio Author - Data from Glassnode Studio This, to me, looks like a bubble that is being propped up by ever shrinking activity. Fewer people are utilizing Bitcoin today than they were in any of the last five years. Of course, this doesn't mean that fewer people own it. One analysis found that 28% of American adults, which translates to roughly 65 million people, currently own some form of cryptocurrency. But this does not necessarily mean that cryptocurrency is going to remain relevant. In fact, the ownership percentage in the US is down from the 30% seen back in 2023 and the 33% seen back in 2022. Furthermore, while data is hard to come by, it is generally accepted that a vast majority of cryptocurrency is owned for investment or speculative purposes. Those who are bullish on Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies sometimes liken it to precious metals like gold and silver. But these comparisons are tenuous at best. One obvious difference is that precious metals are truly tangible and will exist forever. Cryptocurrency is nothing but code. Another difference is that precious metals are used for far more than just investment or speculative purposes. In 2024, only 23.7% of gold was used for investment purposes. Another 21% was used by central banks. However, other major categories included jewelry and technology. Jewelry accounted for 40.3% of demand, while technology accounted for 6.6%. Central banks have not come even close to fully accepting cryptocurrency. In fact, the US and China combined own less than 2% of all Bitcoin that will ever be issued. It has no use for jewelry or technology either. At the end of the day, it can only be used for transactions or speculative purposes. And at this time, most of it seems to be for speculation. Takeaway The data right now does not look particularly pleasant for those who are bullish about Bitcoin. The cryptocurrency appears to be propped up by nothing more than a shrinking number of ardent supporters. While it is possible that we could see further price spikes in the near term, a dwindling number of users utilizing the faux currency less and less does not bode well for the bubble that I believe exists in this market. At the end of the day, this leaves me with no choice but to reaffirm Bitcoin as a ‚Äòstrong sell‚Äô at this time.

title: Crypto price analysis for April 2025: Ethereum (ETH), Solana (SOL), Pepe (PEPE), Mutuum Finance (MUTM)
body: Investors are closely watching Ethereum (ETH), Solana (SOL), Pepe (PEPE), and Mutuum Finance (MUTM) to determine which assets will lead the next market rally, with April 2025 approaching. Ethereum is facing resistance near $1,808, while Solana continues to hold steady above $126 despite recent volatility. Pepe (PEPE) remains a meme coin favorite with speculative momentum, but it‚Äôs Mutuum Finance (MUTM) that‚Äôs turning heads. It launched its fourth phase of funding during its altcoin presale where investors bought it at $0.025 while contributing over $6 million. More than 7700 investors have entered at the current price levels because they expect a projected 20% price surge before the upcoming stage to $0.03. The launch price at $0.06 gives investors who enter during this period the potential to receive a 140% profit. Mutuum Finance presale Mutuum Finance attracts significant investor attention because it implements decentralized finance solutions for crypto loans together with decentralized finance funding mechanisms for its financial service development. The project grows steadily because it acquired more than $6 million from investors and now engages a growing number of 7700 investors. Investors face limited entry choices given a $0.025 Phase 4 token price because of a 20% price boost next stage to $0.03. Investors who participate in the current presale period will receive 140% profits from their investment because the platform already set a future price at $0.06. Mutuum Finance steers the decentralized market ahead using its innovative lending solution and its established market position. The Mutuum Finance team is working on getting its smart contract audited by certik and once that will be finalized it will be announced on social media. The dual-model system of crypto lending Mutuum Finance operates a contemporary lending platform which combines Peer-to-Contract and Peer-to-Peer lending models to enable better access to assets and transparency for user empowerment. Smart contract pools benefit from Peer-to-Contrast Model users who supply their stablecoins for instant borrowing access by platform users and receive passive income. Thanks to automated interest rate modification through smart contracts both lenders get better earnings and borrowers experience less expense in borrowing. The P2P model enables users to form decentralized lending relationships without middlemen while obtaining full negotiation freedoms. The transparent system allows borrowers and lenders to build customized loan arrangements for transactions so they can achieve better user-friendly options. Rewarding early investors and growing the community Mutuum Finance is actively expanding its community by offering lucrative incentives. A $100,000 giveaway will distribute $10,000 worth of MUTM tokens to 10 lucky participants, while an innovative referral program rewards users for introducing new investors. title: Revolutionary Algorand Water Credits: Portugal‚Äôs Indaqua Leads Sustainable Tokenization
body: In an exciting development bridging environmental sustainability with blockchain innovation, Portugal‚Äôs leading water management company, Indaqua, is taking a plunge into the world of cryptocurrency. Imagine a world where conserving water not only benefits the environment but also translates into tangible digital assets. This vision is rapidly becoming a reality as Indaqua collaborates with Hypercube‚Äôs Wateract (WRT) to introduce tokenized water credits on the energy-efficient Algorand blockchain. Let‚Äôs dive into how this groundbreaking initiative is set to reshape corporate water footprint management and champion environmental responsibility. What are Algorand Water Credits and Why are They Revolutionary? At the heart of this initiative lies the concept of water credits , a novel approach to quantifying and incentivizing water conservation. Think of them as environmental offsets, but specifically for water usage. For every unit of wastewater Indaqua successfully treats and converts, an equivalent amount of Wateract (WRT) credits are issued. These credits, built on the robust and eco-friendly Algorand blockchain , can then be purchased by companies looking to neutralize their water footprint. But why is this revolutionary? Transparency and Traceability: Blockchain technology ensures that every water credit is transparently recorded and easily traceable. This eliminates ambiguity and fosters trust in the system. Efficiency and Speed: Algorand, known for its speed and low transaction fees, provides an efficient platform for issuing and trading these water credits. This makes the process seamless and cost-effective. Incentivizing Sustainable Practices: By creating a market for water credits, Indaqua and Hypercube are directly incentivizing companies to reduce their water consumption and support sustainable water management practices. Global Applicability: The digital nature of tokenization and blockchain allows this system to be potentially scaled and adopted globally, addressing water scarcity challenges on a larger scale. The Power of Tokenization for Environmental Impact Tokenization is the process of converting rights to an asset into a digital token on a blockchain. In this case, the asset is ‚Äòsaved water‚Äô or ‚Äòtreated wastewater‚Äô. Why is this approach so powerful for environmental initiatives? Traditional methods of environmental offsetting can often be complex, opaque, and lack verification. Tokenization , especially on a public blockchain like Algorand, addresses these issues head-on: Increased Liquidity: Tokenized assets can be easily traded on digital exchanges, creating a more liquid market for environmental credits compared to traditional, often bureaucratic, systems. Fractional Ownership: Tokenization allows for the fractionalization of water credits, making it accessible for businesses of all sizes to participate in offsetting their water footprint. Automated Verification: Smart contracts on the blockchain can automate the verification and issuance of water credits based on pre-defined criteria, reducing manual intervention and increasing accuracy. Enhanced Security: Blockchain‚Äôs inherent security features ensure the integrity and immutability of water credit transactions, preventing fraud and double-counting. Indaqua and Hypercube: Pioneering Sustainability in Portugal Sustainability is no longer a buzzword; it‚Äôs a business imperative. Indaqua, a leading water and wastewater management company in Portugal, recognizes this and is taking proactive steps to integrate sustainable practices into its operations. Their collaboration with Hypercube‚Äôs Wateract (WRT) is a testament to their commitment. Indaqua‚Äôs expertise in water management, combined with Hypercube‚Äôs blockchain proficiency, creates a powerful synergy. By leveraging Algorand‚Äôs technology, they are not just issuing water credits ; they are building a robust and transparent ecosystem for corporate water stewardship in Portugal and potentially beyond. Key aspects of this partnership include: Aspect Description Company Collaboration Indaqua (Water Management) & Hypercube (Blockchain Technology) Technology Platform Algorand Blockchain ‚Äì known for speed, security, and environmental friendliness. Credit Type Wateract (WRT) ‚Äì Utility token representing water credits. Objective Enable companies to offset their water footprint by purchasing WRT credits. Geographic Focus Initially Portugal, with potential for global expansion. Navigating the Challenges and Embracing the Future of Water Credits While the potential of water credits on the blockchain is immense, some challenges need to be addressed for widespread adoption: Regulatory Framework: Clear regulatory guidelines for environmental tokenization and trading are crucial to provide legal certainty and encourage participation. Standardization: Establishing industry standards for measuring and verifying water savings is essential to ensure the credibility and comparability of water credits. Market Education: Educating businesses about the benefits of water credits and how they can effectively integrate them into their sustainability strategies is vital. Scalability and Adoption: Ensuring the system can scale to accommodate growing demand and encouraging broad adoption across various industries are key to long-term success. Despite these challenges, the Indaqua-Hypercube initiative represents a significant step forward in leveraging blockchain for environmental good. It showcases how innovative technologies can be used to create market-based solutions for pressing global issues like water scarcity. Actionable Insights: Are Water Credits the Next Frontier in Corporate Responsibility? For businesses looking to enhance their environmental, social, and governance (ESG) profiles, exploring water credits presents a compelling opportunity. Here are some actionable insights: Assess Your Water Footprint: Understand your company‚Äôs water consumption across your operations and supply chain. Explore Water Reduction Strategies: Implement water-efficient technologies and practices to minimize your water usage. Consider Water Credit Offsetting: Investigate purchasing water credits to offset unavoidable water consumption and support water conservation projects. Engage with Blockchain Initiatives: Stay informed about developments in environmental tokenization and explore opportunities to participate in blockchain-based sustainability initiatives. Communicate Your Commitment: Publicly communicate your efforts towards water stewardship and sustainability , including your involvement in water credit programs. Conclusion: A Transformative Step Towards Water-Positive Future Indaqua‚Äôs pioneering collaboration with Hypercube to issue water credits on the Algorand blockchain is more than just a news story; it‚Äôs a glimpse into a future where environmental responsibility and technological innovation converge. By tokenizing water conservation efforts, they are creating a powerful incentive system that can drive real change in how businesses manage and value water. This initiative not only positions Portugal as a leader in sustainable innovation but also sets a precedent for other nations and industries to follow. As we face increasing environmental challenges, such innovative approaches offer a beacon of hope, demonstrating how we can leverage technology to build a more sustainable and water-positive world. To learn more about the latest cryptocurrency trends, explore our article on key developments shaping crypto market trends.

title: BitMEX Unveils Enhanced BMEX Token Utility with Increased Staking Rewards and Lower Trading Fees
body: Mahe, Seychelles, April 1st, 2025, Chainwire Traders can now enjoy a 50% boost in BMEX staking rewards, up to 70% in trading fee discounts, yield-generating airdrops, and more. BitMEX , the OG crypto derivatives exchange, today announced significant enhancements to its BMEX Token ecosystem, introducing¬†higher staking rewards, reduced trading fees, and expanded token utility. These improvements were designed to provide greater value and flexibility for traders on the platform. The latest updates to BMEX include: Increased staking rewards ‚Äì Users can now potentially earn up to 7.5% yield by staking BMEX, a 50% increase from previous rates. Lower trading fees ‚Äì BMEX holders can unlock trading fee discounts of up to 70%. Easier access to competitive fee tiers ‚Äì More traders can now qualify for reduced fees and enhanced benefits. "The BMEX Token is a cornerstone of our ecosystem and the expansion of BMEX‚Äôs utility reflects our ongoing commitment to rewarding our users,‚Äù said Stephan Lutz, CEO of BitMEX. ‚ÄúBy increasing staking rewards, lowering access to competitive fee tiers, and introducing new token incentives, we are empowering traders with more opportunities to optimise their trading experience on our platform." BMEX, the native utility of the BitMEX exchange, is designed to fuel traders' financial growth through staking rewards, trading fee discounts, withdrawal fee refunds, and exclusive privileges. The token's benefits are further enhanced by BitMEX's monthly token burn programme, which drives long-term demand and ecosystem growth. For more details on the revamped BMEX structure, users can visit here . Additionally, new and returning traders on BitMEX can enjoy up to $5,000 in BMEX airdrops within their first 30 days. Users can sign up here . Since its founding, no cryptocurrency has been lost through intrusion or hacking, allowing BitMEX users to trade safely in the knowledge that their funds are secure. BitMEX was also one of the first exchanges to publish their on-chain Proof of Reserves and Proof of Liabilities data. The exchange continues to publish this data twice a week ‚Äì proving assurance that they safely store and segregate the funds they are entrusted with. title: Bitcoin Price Forecast: Can a Global Liquidity Recovery Trigger a Bitcoin Rally?

However, reports suggest that the global liquidity has touched its bottom. Could Bitcoin see a reversal? Here is what you should know! According to experts, there is a 80% correction between Bitcoin and global liquidity. A correlation of 80% is very high. This means that there is an 80% probability that the price of Bitcoin will go up if the global liquidity improves. Global liquidity has bottomed. The correlation between Bitcoin and global liquidity is 80%. title: Kentucky drops Coinbase staking lawsuit after passing Bitcoin Rights Bill
body: The state of Kentucky has dropped its lawsuit against Coinbase, marking the end of almost two years of fighting with the exchange on its staking services. A joint court filing by the Kentucky Department of Financial Institutions and the crypto exchange disclosed this on March 31. The filing shows that both parties agreed to dismiss the lawsuit without prejudice. This adds Kentucky to the growing list of states that are dropping their legal action against Coinbase after they sued the exchange for its staking service in 2023 which they said amounts to unregistered securities. Vermont and South Carolina have also dismissed. Kentucky and Coinbase court filing. Source: Coinbase Coinbase is one of the biggest staking-as-a-service operators in the US, with 3.84 million ETH staked and 120,000 validators under its control. The exchange is also the largest node operator, with 11.42% of staked ETH. However, staking has attracted concerns from state and federal regulators for years, with some exchanges, such as Kraken, even paying fines for offering staking service. All that has changed since President Donald Trump was sworn in. Regulators have become more receptive to the crypto industry at the state and federal levels. This was what influenced Vermont to drop its own action on March 14, with the state noting that the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) had dismissed its lawsuit against the exchange. Nevertheless, seven states, including California, Washington, Maryland, Alabama, Wisconsin, New Jersey, and Illinois, still have enforcement actions pending against Coinbase. It is likely that these states will eventually dismiss their lawsuits as well. In the meantime, Coinbase chief legal counsel Paul Grewal took to X to complain about the state-driven regulatory approach to issues such as crypto staking, noting that Congress needs to step in with federal legislation. He said: ‚ÄúCongress needs to end this litigation-driven, state-by-state approach with a federal market structure law ASAP.‚Äù Before now, Grewal had described the several lawsuit dismissals as a win for the crypto industry, innovation and consumers. According to him, the lawsuit that made Coinbase suspend its staking service in South Carolina cost the state residents $2 million in staking rewards. Kentucky‚Äôs new Bitcoin Rights law led to Coinbase lawsuit dismissal While Grewal is calling for federal legislation on issues such as staking, it is local laws that made Kentucky dismiss its lawsuit. The dismissal comes less than a week after Governor Andy Beshear signed the Bitcoin Rights Bill into law. The law, which grants state residents the right to self-custody, use digital assets, and operate nodes, also provided legal clarity for the crypto industry. Under the law, mining and staking are no longer considered securities, and node operators are no longer classified as money transmitters. The bill was introduced on February 19, which means it took less than two months for legislators to pass it through the two chambers of the state legislature and for the governor to assent to it. Besides its clarity on staking and mining, it also bans any zoning changes that will discriminate against crypto mining. Meanwhile, Kentucky also has a bill on establishing a Bitcoin reserve that could see the state allocate up to 10% of its portfolio to digital assets. That proposed legislation is still undergoing review. Cryptopolitan Academy: Coming Soon - A New Way to Earn Passive Income with DeFi in 2025. Learn More

title: US government set to reveal Bitcoin and crypto holdings on April 5
body: The US Department of the Treasury and other federal departments will publicly disclose their cryptocurrency holdings on April 5, following President Trump‚Äôs directives on March 6. The order entails the establishment of the Strategic Bitcoin Reserve and a Digital Asset Stockpile with the goal of considering Bitcoin a key national asset. The upcoming disclosure will reveal what the government owns at the moment and its plan regarding digital assets in the future. The US government is considering holding Bitcoin long-term Under the executive order signed by Trump, federal agencies were asked to submit their balance sheets on cryptocurrencies within one month. The Treasury Secretary¬†is required to create two new executive offices to oversee the government‚Äôs digital properties. This initiative aims to make the U.S. Treasury hold Bitcoin in the same way it holds gold, having a vault-like ‚Äúdigital Fort Knox.‚Äù The Strategic Bitcoin Reserve is for Bitcoin acquired from the seizure of properties related to criminal and civil litigation, and the government has agreed not to dispose of these assets. According to BTC Inc. CEO David Bailey, the price volatility in the last couple of months is due to the audit results. However, this decline came about even while the Bitcoin Reserve was established. April 5th (this Saturday) the USA must complete a full audit of the nation‚Äôs bitcoin holdings. Depending on what we learn, might answer many of the open questions about the recent price action. ‚Äî David Baileyüáµüá∑ $0.85mm/btc is the floor (@DavidFBailey) March 31, 2025 Data from Arkham Intelligence shows that the US Government currently possesses 198,012 Bitcoin, worth about $16 billion. The government sold around 50% of the 400,000 mined over the last decade, garnering $366 million. These assets would now fetch a valuation exceeding $17 billion. Proposed $200 billion ‚Äò‚Çø Bonds‚Äô could save U.S. taxpayers billions Further elevating the strategic shift towards cryptocurrency even higher, the Bitcoin Policy Institute presented the government with a proposal to purchase Bitcoin without using the money from the taxpayers. Accordingly, the Institute advises the issuing of ‚Äú$2 trillion worth of Bitcoin-Enhanced Treasury Bonds‚Äù referred to as ‚Äú‚Çø Bonds‚Äù. These ‚Çø Bonds would allocate 90% of the proceeds to traditional government funding while using the remaining 10% to purchase Bitcoin. They would have a relatively lower 1% interest rate which is much lower than the current 10-year treasury yield that averages 4.5%. Investors, on the other hand, receive exposure to Bitcoin‚Äôs returns through structured payoff at maturity. The bond structure provides full repayment while adding even more Bitcoin-based returns into the mix to entice investors with a blend of security and crypto-related income streams. Financial modeling by the Institute indicates that the changes will save taxpayers huge sums of money. Despite having an unchanging Bitcoin price for the past 10 years, the government could still save around $354 billion even if it spends $200 billion to buy Bitcoin. If Bitcoin follows historical performance, large parts of the national debt could be offset by 2045. Furthermore, ‚Çø Bonds‚Äô costs include tax-exempting status for interest and Bitcoin profits, which enhances their utility as consumer-welfare stores of value. Over 132 million households in the United States are expected to take part, at an average of $3,025 per household. Institutional and international investors would absorb 80% of the bonds, while U.S. households would take 20%. Cryptopolitan Academy: Want to grow your money in 2025? title: Tabichain‚Äôs Strategic TGE Delay: Navigating Challenges in the Cosmos Blockchain Ecosystem
body: Heads up, crypto enthusiasts! Tabichain, the Cosmos-based Layer-1 blockchain that‚Äôs been generating significant buzz, has announced a strategic shift in its roadmap. The team has decided to postpone its highly anticipated Token Generation Event (TGE), initially slated for the first quarter. This news, delivered via an official X (formerly Twitter) announcement, has sparked conversations across the crypto community. But what‚Äôs behind this decision, and what does it mean for the future of Tabichain and the broader Cosmos ecosystem? Let‚Äôs dive into the details. Understanding Tabichain: A Consumer-Centric Cosmos-Based Layer-1 Blockchain For those just tuning in, Tabichain is designed as a cutting-edge Layer-1 blockchain built on the robust and interoperable Cosmos blockchain network. Imagine a blockchain specifically tailored for the everyday consumer ‚Äì that‚Äôs Tabichain‚Äôs vision. It aims to simplify blockchain technology, making it more accessible and user-friendly for a wide range of applications, from decentralized social media to next-gen gaming and beyond. By leveraging the power of Cosmos, Tabichain seeks to create a seamless and interconnected blockchain experience. Key Aspects of Tabichain: Cosmos Ecosystem Foundation: Built on the Cosmos SDK, Tabichain benefits from the Inter-Blockchain Communication (IBC) protocol, enabling interoperability with other Cosmos chains. This positions Tabichain within a vibrant and growing ecosystem of interconnected blockchains. Consumer Focus: Unlike some blockchains geared primarily towards developers or enterprises, Tabichain is explicitly designed for consumer applications. This focus drives its development choices, aiming for ease of use and intuitive interfaces. Layer-1 Architecture: As a Layer-1 blockchain, Tabichain provides its own foundational infrastructure. This allows for greater control over scalability, security, and customization compared to building on existing platforms. Vision for Decentralized Applications (dApps): Tabichain aims to be the go-to platform for developers building consumer-facing dApps. Its architecture is optimized to support high transaction volumes and user-friendly experiences. Why the TGE Postponement? Unpacking Tabichain‚Äôs Challenges The announcement of the Token Generation Event postponement cited a combination of factors. It‚Äôs not uncommon in the fast-paced world of crypto for projects to adjust timelines. Tabichain pointed to challenges across four key areas: Technical Development: Building a robust and scalable Layer-1 blockchain is a complex undertaking. Unforeseen technical hurdles or the need for further optimization can necessitate timeline adjustments. This is a common reality in blockchain development, where innovation is constantly pushing the boundaries of technology. Market Preparation: The crypto market is notoriously volatile and influenced by numerous external factors. Projects often need to carefully time their TGE to coincide with favorable market conditions to maximize success and community engagement. Perhaps Tabichain is waiting for a more opportune moment in the market cycle. Token Economics: Crafting a sustainable and effective tokenomic model is crucial for the long-term health of any blockchain project. Refining token distribution, utility, and incentives can be a complex process that requires thorough analysis and potentially, adjustments based on evolving market dynamics and community feedback. Strategic Direction: The crypto landscape is constantly evolving. Projects must be agile and adapt to new trends and opportunities. A postponement could indicate a strategic pivot or refinement in Tabichain‚Äôs overall direction, ensuring it aligns with the current and future needs of the market and its users. It‚Äôs important to note that while a delay might initially seem like negative news, it can often be a sign of a project prioritizing quality and long-term success over rushing to market. A well-considered postponement can allow Tabichain to address challenges comprehensively and emerge stronger. The Significance of a Token Generation Event (TGE) in Crypto For those newer to the crypto space, understanding what a Token Generation Event entails is crucial. The TGE , also sometimes referred to as an Initial Coin Offering (ICO) or Initial DEX Offering (IDO), is a pivotal moment for a blockchain project. It marks the public launch of the project‚Äôs native token. Key Aspects of a TGE: Token Distribution: The TGE is when the project‚Äôs tokens are first distributed to the public, often in exchange for other cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin or Ethereum. This distribution can occur through various mechanisms, including public sales, private sales, and airdrops. Funding and Community Building: TGEs are a primary means for blockchain projects to raise capital to fund development, marketing, and operations. They also serve as a crucial step in building a community around the project. Token Utility and Ecosystem Growth: The TGE introduces the project‚Äôs native token, which typically plays a vital role within the blockchain‚Äôs ecosystem. Tokens can be used for transaction fees, governance, staking, accessing platform features, and more. A successful TGE can kickstart ecosystem growth and adoption. Market Entry and Price Discovery: Once tokens are distributed through the TGE, they typically become tradable on cryptocurrency exchanges. This marks the project‚Äôs entry into the broader crypto market and allows for price discovery based on supply and demand. Therefore, the timing and execution of a TGE are critical for a project‚Äôs trajectory. A delay, while potentially causing short-term disappointment, can be a strategic move to ensure a more successful and impactful launch in the long run. Navigating the Token Generation Event Landscape: Lessons from Tabichain‚Äôs Delay Tabichain‚Äôs decision to postpone its TGE offers valuable lessons for both projects and participants in the crypto space. It highlights the complexities involved in launching a successful blockchain and the importance of strategic decision-making. Key Takeaways: Realistic Timelines are Crucial: The crypto industry is known for ambitious timelines, but building robust technology takes time. Tabichain‚Äôs delay underscores the need for realistic development schedules and the flexibility to adjust as needed. Market Conditions Matter: External market factors play a significant role in the success of a TGE . Projects must be attuned to market sentiment and be prepared to adapt their launch plans accordingly. Tokenomics Refinement is Ongoing: Creating effective token economics is not a one-time task. Continuous evaluation and refinement are necessary to ensure the token model remains sustainable and aligned with the project‚Äôs goals. Strategic Agility is Key: The ability to adapt to changing circumstances and make strategic adjustments, even if it means delaying a highly anticipated event, is a sign of a mature and responsible project team. The Future of Tabichain and the Cosmos Ecosystem While the TGE postponement is a change in the immediate timeline, it doesn‚Äôt diminish the long-term potential of Tabichain . As a Cosmos-based Layer-1 blockchain focused on consumers, Tabichain addresses a significant need in the crypto space ‚Äì making blockchain technology more accessible and user-friendly. The strategic decision to delay the TGE suggests a commitment to ensuring a stronger and more successful launch when the time is right. The Cosmos blockchain ecosystem continues to grow and evolve, and Tabichain is poised to be a valuable addition. By taking the time to address technical, market, tokenomic, and strategic considerations, Tabichain is positioning itself for long-term success and contribution to the decentralized future. Keep an eye on Tabichain ‚Äì this strategic pause could very well set the stage for an even more impactful entry into the crypto landscape. In conclusion, Tabichain‚Äôs TGE postponement, while initially surprising, appears to be a calculated move aimed at strengthening the project‚Äôs foundation and ensuring a more successful launch. It‚Äôs a reminder that in the dynamic world of crypto, strategic patience and adaptability can be powerful assets. The future remains bright for Tabichain and its vision for a consumer-centric blockchain experience within the Cosmos ecosystem. title: Bitcoin mining using coal energy down 43% since 2011 ‚Äî Report
body: The use of hydrocarbon fuels in mining Bitcoin has seen a sharp decline over the past 13 years, with the use of coal energy in mining dropping significantly. The share of coal energy use in Bitcoin ( BTC ) mining has dropped from 63% in 2011 to 20% in 2024, an average annual decrease of roughly 8%, according to a new report released on March 31 by the MiCA Crypto Alliance in collaboration with the risk metrics data platform Nodiens. In parallel, the share of renewable energy used in Bitcoin mining has steadily increased, growing at an average rate of 5.8% per year. Bitcoin absolute energy consumption trends and share of renewable and coal energy. Source: MiCA Crypto Alliance The data reflects a steady shift of Bitcoin mining to cleaner and more sustainable energy solutions, with the study forecasting further decarbonization and mitigation of BTC‚Äôs environmental footprint in the coming years. Global coal energy use surged to new highs in 2024 The transition comes amid rising global coal consumption, adding contrast to Bitcoin‚Äôs changing energy profile. According to the International Energy Agency (IEA), a Paris-based intergovernmental policy organization, global coal use surged to a new record in 2024, estimated at 8.8 billion tonnes. Global coal consumption from 2000 to 2026. Source: IEA According to the IEA, global demand for coal energy is set to stay close to record levels through 2027 as emerging economies like India, Indonesia and Vietnam are expected to see a sharp rise in coal consumption in the coming years. Five scenarios for Bitcoin‚Äôs energy path to 2030 The report lays out five future scenarios for Bitcoin‚Äôs carbon footprint, ranging from a bearish $10,000 BTC price to an ultra-bullish $1 million scenario. The study specifically included five BTC price scenarios, with $10,000 considered as a low price scenario, a base price scenario at $110,000, a medium price scenario at $250,000, a high price scenario at $500,000 and a ‚Äúvery bullish‚Äù price scenario at $1 million per BTC. Peak annual carbon footprint estimations for different Bitcoin price scenarios and IEA‚Äôs different energy transition scenarios. Source: MiCA Crypto Alliance In a medium price scenario, renewable energy is estimated to constitute between 59.3% and 74.3% of Bitcoin‚Äôs total electricity usage, depending on the policy scenario, excluding nuclear energy use, the report stated. Related: Crusoe to sell Bitcoin mining business to NYDIG to focus on AI The report also mentions an expected peak in Bitcoin mining energy consumption around 2030, echoing a similar forecast in a study by the digital asset platform NYDIG released in September 2021. According to NYDIG‚Äôs estimations, even in a high-price scenario, Bitcoin‚Äôs electricity consumption would peak at 11 times its 2020 level, but it will only account for 0.4% of global primary energy consumption and 2% of global electricity generation. title: Shocking Crypto Hacks Expose $33.46M Losses in March: Is Your Crypto Safe?
body: Hold onto your hats, crypto enthusiasts! March 2024 turned out to be another rollercoaster month in the digital currency world, but not in a good way. While we often celebrate the gains and innovations, it‚Äôs crucial to face the harsh realities too. A recent report from blockchain security firm PeckShield reveals a sobering statistic: 20 crypto hacks occurred in March alone, resulting in a staggering $33.46 million in total losses . This news serves as a stark reminder of the ever-present risks in the cryptocurrency space and underscores the critical need for robust cryptocurrency security measures. Unveiling the March Crypto Hacks: A Detailed Breakdown PeckShield, a reputable name in blockchain security, broke the news via their PeckShieldAlert X account, painting a concerning picture of the crypto landscape in March. Twenty separate incidents of crypto hacks were recorded, each contributing to the hefty $33.46 million loss. Let‚Äôs delve deeper into some of the major breaches that headlined this month of turmoil: Abracadabra.money: Topping the list with a jaw-dropping $13 million loss, this decentralized finance (DeFi) platform suffered a significant blow. The specifics of the hack are still being analyzed, but the sheer scale of the theft is a major concern for users and investors in the DeFi sector. Zoth: Following closely behind, Zoth experienced a painful $8.32 million exploit. Details surrounding this DeFi hack are also emerging, but the substantial amount lost highlights the vulnerabilities that can plague even projects aiming to innovate in the decentralized finance arena. 1inch: A well-known name in the decentralized exchange (DEX) aggregator space, 1inch was also targeted, with hackers making off with approximately $5 million. This incident is particularly noteworthy as it impacts a platform widely used for its security and efficiency in aggregating DEX liquidity. Why are Crypto Hacks on the Rise? Understanding Cryptocurrency Security Challenges The increasing frequency of crypto hacks raises a crucial question: why are these digital heists becoming so common? Several factors contribute to this worrying trend, highlighting the ongoing challenges in cryptocurrency security : Complexity of Smart Contracts: DeFi platforms heavily rely on smart contracts, which are self-executing agreements written in code. However, the complexity of these contracts can introduce vulnerabilities if not rigorously audited and tested. Hackers are constantly searching for loopholes in these intricate systems. Open-Source Nature: While transparency is a core tenet of blockchain, the open-source nature of many crypto projects can also be a double-edged sword. Malicious actors can scrutinize the code for weaknesses, potentially identifying exploits before developers can patch them. Human Error: Even with the most secure technology, human error remains a significant factor. Mistakes in code, weak security practices by users (like poor password management or phishing susceptibility), and insider threats can all create openings for crypto losses . Evolving Attack Vectors: Hackers are constantly refining their techniques, developing new and sophisticated methods to breach security protocols. As blockchain technology evolves, so too do the attack vectors, demanding continuous adaptation and innovation in security measures. Decentralized and Less Regulated Space: The decentralized nature of cryptocurrency, while empowering, also means less centralized oversight and regulation compared to traditional financial systems. This can make it harder to track down and prosecute cybercriminals involved in crypto hacks , emboldening malicious activity. The Devastating Impact of Crypto Losses: Beyond the Dollar Amount While the $33.46 million figure is substantial, the impact of crypto losses extends far beyond just the monetary value. These incidents can have profound consequences for individuals and the wider crypto ecosystem: Erosion of Trust: Each major hack chips away at the trust that users and investors have in the cryptocurrency space. When platforms touted for their security fall victim to exploits, it can breed skepticism and hinder wider adoption. Financial Hardship for Individuals: For individuals who lose their crypto holdings in these hacks, the financial impact can be devastating. Unlike traditional banking, recovering stolen cryptocurrency is often extremely difficult, if not impossible. Reputational Damage for Projects: Projects that suffer DeFi hacks or other security breaches face significant reputational damage. Recovering from such incidents and regaining user confidence can be a long and arduous process. Setback for Innovation: The constant threat of hacks can stifle innovation in the crypto space. Developers and entrepreneurs may become more cautious and less willing to push boundaries if security concerns overshadow the potential for progress. Regulatory Scrutiny: Increased instances of crypto hacks often lead to greater regulatory scrutiny of the cryptocurrency industry. Governments and regulatory bodies may feel compelled to impose stricter rules and oversight to protect consumers and maintain financial stability. Navigating the Landscape of Crypto Hacks: Actionable Insights for Security While the news of March crypto hacks is concerning, it‚Äôs not all doom and gloom. There are proactive steps that individuals and projects can take to bolster cryptocurrency security and mitigate risks: For Individuals For Crypto Projects/Platforms Use Hardware Wallets: Store your crypto offline in hardware wallets for enhanced security against online threats. Enable 2FA: Utilize two-factor authentication (2FA) on all crypto exchange and platform accounts. Be Vigilant Against Phishing: Exercise caution with emails, links, and messages, and verify the authenticity of websites before entering credentials. Diversify Holdings: Don‚Äôt keep all your crypto eggs in one basket. Diversify across different platforms and wallets. Stay Informed: Keep up-to-date on the latest security threats and best practices in the crypto space. Conduct Regular Security Audits: Engage reputable security firms to conduct thorough audits of smart contracts and platform infrastructure. Implement Robust Security Protocols: Adopt industry-leading security measures, including encryption, intrusion detection systems, and multi-signature wallets. Bug Bounty Programs: Incentivize white-hat hackers to identify and report vulnerabilities in your code through bug bounty programs. Incident Response Plan: Develop a comprehensive incident response plan to effectively handle security breaches and minimize damage. Transparency and Communication: Be transparent with users about security measures and communicate promptly in case of any incidents. Conclusion: Turning Setbacks into Stepping Stones for a Secure Crypto Future The revelation of 20 crypto hacks in March, culminating in millions of dollars lost, serves as a harsh but necessary wake-up call. It underscores the persistent vulnerabilities in the cryptocurrency ecosystem and the critical importance of prioritizing cryptocurrency security . While these crypto losses are undoubtedly setbacks, they also present an opportunity for growth and improvement. By learning from these incidents, strengthening security protocols, and fostering a culture of vigilance, the crypto community can work towards building a more resilient and secure future for decentralized finance. The journey towards mainstream adoption hinges on establishing trust, and robust security is the cornerstone of that trust. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action.

title: Ethereum Reclaims Top as Leading DEX Chain! Is the Expected Return Coming? Here Are the Details
body: Ethereum has reclaimed its position as the top blockchain for decentralized exchange (DEX) trading, surpassing Solana for the first time since September 2024. Ethereum Reclaims Top as Leading DEX Chain, Surpasses Solana for First Time Since September This shift comes amid a broader market downturn, particularly in the memecoin sector, which has seen a decline in speculative activity. According to DefiLlama, Ethereum-based DEXs recorded a cumulative trading volume of $64.62 billion in March, surpassing Solana‚Äôs $52.62 billion by 22%. This signals a return to dominance for Ethereum, which had lagged behind Solana in recent months. Market Conditions and Declining Solana Activity The leadership change comes as total cryptocurrency market capitalization fell 4.2% to $2.63 trillion, continuing the 20% decline from February. The market downturn was affected by macroeconomic uncertainty and investor frustration over the lack of new Bitcoin purchases in the US strategic reserve, sending Bitcoin prices falling below $80,000. The downtrend has significantly impacted Solana‚Äôs ecosystem, especially its leading DEX, Raydium, which is a hotspot for memecoin trading. Throughout March, Raydium did not record a single day with trading volume exceeding $1 billion, a sharp decline from the record $13 billion on January 18. Additionally, daily volumes on Solana‚Äôs memecoin launchpad have fallen below $100 million from a peak of $390 million in mid-January. Much of Solana‚Äôs previous dominance was attributed to the frenzy surrounding memecoin trading, including the launch of the TRUMP token in January, which briefly caused a spike in activity. The Resurgence of Ethereum Ethereum‚Äôs return to the top was largely driven by Uniswap, which accounted for over $30 billion in trading volume, while Fluid, another Ethereum-based DEX, followed with $9 billion in trading volume. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Ethereum Reclaims Top as Leading DEX Chain! Is the Expected Return Coming? Here Are the Details

title: Tether Bought 8,888 Bitcoin in Q1 for $735M; Total Holdings Rise to 92.6K
body: Stablecoin issuer Tether increased its bitcoin holdings to 92,646 BTC, adding 8,888 BTC for $735 million in the first quarter of 2025. The company is staying true to its plan to put 15% of its profits each quarter into additional bitcoin purchases. Its current bitcoin stack is worth $7.7 billion at bitcoin's current price just above $83,000. Tether's USDT stablecoin is the world's largest with a $143 billion market cap. The company raked in $13 billion in profits last year, mostly from interest on its vast holdings of U.S. Treasuries backing USDT.

title: Grayscale files to convert Digital Large Cap Fund into ETF
body: Grayscale Investments has filed an S-3 form with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to convert its Digital Large Cap Fund into an exchange-traded fund. The April 1 filing seeks to transition the private investment vehicle into a publicly traded product, broadening investor access. The Digital Large Cap Fund currently consists of Bitcoin ( BTC ), Ethereum ( ETH ), XRP ( XRP ), Solana ( SOL ), and Cardano ( ADA ). Previously available only to accredited investors through private placements, the fund‚Äôs conversion into an ETF would allow retail investors exposure to a diversified basket of digital assets. Since launching in 2018, the fund‚Äôs market price has surged 478.83%, according to Grayscale. The company has stated that the fund covers approximately 75% of the digital asset market cap, excluding meme coins and stablecoins . You might also like: AI‚Äôs trust problem can be solved using ZK solutions | Opinion Crypto going mainstream If approved, the move would align with Grayscale‚Äôs strategy of integrating crypto into mainstream investments. The filing follows a broader trend of crypto ETF approvals, including spot Bitcoin ETFs in January 2024 and Ethereum ETFs in May. Grayscale‚Äôs latest application follows its separate efforts to launch an Avalanche ( AVAX ) ETF, for which Nasdaq recently filed a 19b-4 form with the SEC. The firm also recently filed for a Hedera ( HBAR ) ETF, signaling its continued push for crypto ETF expansion. You might also like: Ethena‚Äôs USDtb enters top 10 stablecoins by market cap amid March stablecoin shakeup: report

title: Hacker transfers $70M out of payment platform UPCX
body: Update April 1, 1:42 pm UTC: This article has been updated to add comments from Cyvers co-founder and chief technology officer Meir Dolev. An unauthorized party withdrew about $70 million in digital assets from open-source payment platform UPCX, according to a security alert issued on April 1. The blockchain security firm Cyvers flagged suspicious activity involving 18.4 million UPC tokens, estimating the value of the compromised funds at $70 million. Cyvers said someone accessed a UPCX address and upgraded its ProxyAdmin contract. The attacker then executed a function that allows admins to withdraw, leading to fund transfers from three different management accounts. At the time of writing, the stolen tokens had not been swapped for other crypto assets. Cointelegraph contacted UPCX for comment but did not receive an immediate response. UPC price dips by 7% amid unauthorized transfer UPCX acknowledged it had detected ‚Äúunauthorized activity‚Äù involving its management accounts. The team suspended deposits and withdrawals for UPCX in response to the incident. It said user assets are unaffected by the issue and it is actively investigating the matter. UPC‚Äôs token price dropped amid news of the incident. According to CoinGecko, UPC‚Äôs token prices dropped 7%, from a high of $4.06 to a low of $3.77 during the incident. UPCX 24-hour price chart. Source: CoinGecko Related: Hacker steals $8.4M from RWA restaking protocol Zoth UPC hack mirrors previous attack patterns In a statement, Cyvers co-founder and chief technology officer Meir Dolev told Cointelegraph that while the root cause of the attack remained under investigation, these types of incidents often stem from compromised credentials or flawed access control mechanisms. Dolev told Cointelegraph that both of these vulnerabilities have been the predominant cause of Web3 losses in 2024. The executive said the same causes were responsible for over 80% of the stolen funds during the year. The cybersecurity executive also said the attack pattern was similar to previous exploits. Dolev told Cointelegraph: ‚ÄúThis incident mirrors attack patterns we‚Äôve documented in prior exploits, where access to critical administrative roles enabled malicious upgrades and fund drainage.‚Äù The executive added that the hack underscored an urgent need to enhance security around wallet permissions, multisignature implementations and runtime transaction validation. The $70 million stolen in the incident would more than double the amount lost in the previous month. In March, crypto stolen from hacks only reached $33 million . title: Strongest Crypto to Hold in the First Week of April
body: As the crypto market‚Äôs volatility remains, investors‚Äô question is which to hold this week. The historical crypto market reveals that every time March had a bearish end, April turned out to be super bullish for digital assets. Interestingly, April is also an important month, especially the first week, as Donald Trump‚Äôs Liberation Day falls on Wednesday, where right macroeconomic events could push the cryptocurrencies to new highs while the wrong ones could crash the crypto market once again. In such a volatile market, let us discuss the strongest crypto token investors must keep this week and why. Strongest Crypto to Hold This Week As Donald Trump‚Äôs new tariff decision will be revealed on April 2, experts are anticipating high volatility this week. At this time, the investors‚Äô sentiments can significantly affect the top crypto‚Äôs performance, especially those like XRP, which face a heavier impact. At the same time, crypto assets like Pepe Coin and others could become the perfect crypto to hold due to the limited impact of the situation. More importantly, the historical stats reveal that PEPE‚Äôs price has surged multiple times when the crypto market‚Äôs trends were unfavorable. PEPE is the market‚Äôs third biggest and most popular meme coin . Its performance has driven the entire meme-themed cryptos market. Additionally, it is often among the first few tokens to witness recovery due to high crypto whale and investors‚Äô demand. Besides, experts anticipate PEPE will slip Shiba Inu, which has a market cap twice its, indicating its high potential and investors‚Äô trust. Even if this week brings volatility, this is a safe asset with high recovery odds, making this the perfect crypto to hold. How‚Äôs Pepe Coin Performing Today, and What‚Äôs Next? After losing nearly 74% of its performance in the market downtrend, the Pepe Coin price is attempting recovery today. Its value has surged 7% today, currently trading at $0.00000752 with a market capitalization of $3.16B. This surge came amid the broader crypto market recovery and rising investor confidence, as its trading volume has surged 20% to $681.35M. However, this is just the beginning, as crypto analysts anticipate a 2x rally. This Pepe Coin price prediction assumes it breaks the descending trendline and closes the candle above its 50-day EMA. Experts believe this possibility would bring bullish results, catering to a 25% rally and achievement of its February high of $0.00001. Another anticipated 300% surge from the current levels, and PEPE reaching a new ATH of 0.00003466. Conclusion: PEPE is the Crypto to Hold This Week Although the trajectory is not always as predicted, there‚Äôs a certain possibility that Pepe Coin finds better support in the ongoing week, making it the strongest crypto to hold. However, Donald Trump‚Äôs tariff updates may bring different results, calling for further research on the matter. More importantly, ups and downs are part of the market. Investors should focus on diversifying their portfolios, building risk management strategies, etc. The post Strongest Crypto to Hold in the First Week of April appeared first on CoinGape .

title: Professional Fighters League Announces Partnership with Blockchain Analytics Leader Arkham
body: NEW YORK, April 1, 2025 /PRNewswire/ ‚Äî The Professional Fighters League (PFL) today announced a multi-year partnership with Arkham, a leading provider of blockchain analytics and real-time cryptocurrency intelligence. The agreement spans the entire PFL ecosystem, including the 2025 PFL World Tournament, Champions Series, PFL Europe, PFL MENA, and the soon-to-launch PFL Africa. Arkham‚Äôs innovative Intel Platform offers an extensive suite of features, including real-time alerts, customizable dashboards, detailed transaction visualization tools, and advanced filtering capabilities. These features are freely accessible across all major blockchain networks, providing unparalleled insights into cryptocurrency transactions and market movements. To celebrate the partnership, PFL and Arkham will launch an exclusive sweepstakes for fans starting April 1. Participants will have the chance to win an all-expenses-paid trip to the 2025 PFL World Tournament Championship on August 21. The sweepstakes prize includes: Two nights at the luxurious Seminole Hard Rock Hotel and¬†Casino Two cage-side tickets to the Championship event Post-fight photo opportunity in the¬†SmartCage Exclusive meet-and-greet with¬†PFL talent Fans can enter the sweepstakes by following both PFL and Arkham on Instagram and commenting on the upcoming collaborative post. The sweepstakes will run from April 1 to May 1, 2025. More details will be shared on the official PFL and Arkham social media channels. ‚ÄúWe are excited to partner with Arkham to leverage their cutting-edge blockchain analytics technology,‚Äù said Bryan Calka, Chief Commercial Officer of PFL. ‚ÄúArkham‚Äôs sophisticated platform ensures that PFL remains at the forefront of innovation, security, and transparency, aligning seamlessly with our vision to bring unique and valuable experiences to our global fanbase.‚Äù The First Round of the 2025 PFL World Tournament, takes place at Universal Studios Florida on April 3, April 11, April 18, and May 1. The 2025 PFL World Tournament will air live on ESPN platforms in the U.S., Canada, and across Europe, fans can catch the action live on DAZN, while globally, the tournament will be streamed in 190 countries through 20 premium media partners. This partnership was sourced and facilitated by KLUTCH Sports Group‚Äôs Global Partnerships division, led by Andrew Feinberg. ABOUT PROFESSIONAL FIGHTERS LEAGUE Professional Fighters League (PFL ) is a global powerhouse in MMA and the fastest-growing sports league world-wide. PFL is the only MMA organization with the ‚Äúwin and advance‚Äù format. PFL is broadcast and streamed to 190 countries with 20 leading media partners. PFL is backed by major blue-chip investors including SURJ, Ares, Knighthead, Luxor Capital, Waverley Capital, Elysian Park Ventures, 885 Capital, and numerous NBA, MLB, NHL, and MLS team owners. KLUTCH‚Äôs unique, 360 approach helps clients at any stage of their career maximize opportunities across the rapidly changing entertainment, media, and business landscape, and provides strategic support in partnerships, branding, communications, social responsibility, and more. With proven expertise in the intersections of sports, entertainment, and culture, KLUTCH connects top teams, major leagues, and properties with global brands. In 2019, KLUTCH partnered with the leading global talent and entertainment company UTA, and in 2024, was named one of GQ‚Äôs 20 Most Creative Companies in the World. title: Ripple Price Prediction; XRP Could Fall Below $1 Within Weeks As Trading Volume Drops Overs 75%
