title: PayPal vs. Traditional Crypto Exchanges: Competitive Advantages and User Preferences
body: There is lots of chatter around PayPal and cryptocurrencies but it is often hard to find out the details and understand what the platform is actually offering. Is it a Crypto exchange, or can you just use your PayPal account to pay for cryptocurrencies, or can you use cryptocurrencies to pay for goods and services as you would with fiat currencies? We are going to try to take a deep dive and uncover what PayPal is actually offering in our cryptocurrency world and what these newfangled exchanges are. With the cryptocurrency market now worth more than one trillion, it is moving from the margins and taking up itsplace centre stage. In an unstable world, we seem to be seeing a craze for decentralized and digital currencies. Hundreds of virtual currencies are popping up. Relative turmoil The early days of Trump's latest presidency have been synonymous with crypto and speculation, and government policy have ensured the markets are in a constant state of flux. There has been much debate about whether a Trump meme coin launched before his inauguration was a scam for selling collectables or not. Regardless, it unlocked several phishing scams and attacks that led to accounts being hacked and passwords being stolen in under two minutes . Crypto exchanges are not places to buy goods or services with your Bitcoin, Ethereum or Tether, but they work like a stock exchange where investors can buy and sell their digital currencies. To the uninitiated, they can appear quite daunting with their talk of margin or lending trading and future and options trading. Before these exchanges came into being, investors could only obtain crypto via mining or organizing transactions via online and offline forums. Now, there are crypto exchanges operating worldwide with varying levels of security and fee structures. The ideal exchange makes trading easy, has reliable security features and does not charge excessive fees. Crypto Exchanges still relatively new Whether centralized or decentralized, they are a very new concept that try to match buyers and sellers. The pros are that they are an easy, hassle-free way to buy cryptocurrencies, allow legitimate trade, and many offer their users tax forms to make it easier for users to work out crypto taxes. Unfortunately, they are vulnerable to hacks and cyber theft; users do not have the right to hold their private keys, and if the exchanges fail, users cannot access their funds or trade places. This is why many users prefer to trade their cryptocurrencies on an established platform like PayPal. It is quite ironic that PayPal is now regarded as a reliable and almost traditional payment platform when it was once very much the disruptor and challenger . Presumably, at some point in the future, the "disruptor" crypto exchanges will become reliable and totally trustworthy, but for now, the whole exchange market is still quite erratic. PayPal and Crypto increasingly linked Over the past year, there has been a good deal of PayPal crypto news coming out of the US, with the company launching a US Dollar Stablecoin (PYUSD) just about eighteen months ago. The coin is backed by US dollar deposits, US treasuries, and similar cash equivalents, and it has a redemption value of US dollar 1.1. The company announced that PYUSD was also available on the Solano Blockchain, claiming this offered consumers faster and cheaper transactions. MoonPay's integration with the platform back in May 2024 ensures a seamless fiat-to-crypto experience for US-based PayPal customers. In addition, US merchants can now buy, hold and sell cryptocurrency directly from their PayPal business account, and it has sped up and reduced the costs of cross-border money transfers with Xoom. These integrations mean that people in Asia-Pacific and Africa should have better access to digital financial solutions from a trusted source, and businesses will not be restricted by traditional banking hours. PayPal's Senior Vice President of Blockchain, Cryptocurrency and Digital Currencies, Jose Fernandez da Ponte, said, "Cross-border transactions are an important driver for economic growth and prosperity in developing countries with this step, Xoom and its partners, like Cebuana Lhuillier and Yellow Card, will be able to leverage PayPal's payment technologies and the blockchain to enable seamless money transfers across borders further." PayPal is not an Exchange However, regardless of all its forays into crypto, PayPal is not a place to trade crypto for crypto; it is more a place to use, exchange and interchange crypto and fiat currencies. One of the areas where crypto is still most widely used is for people who enjoy a punt at an online casino. If you are Canadian, you will know that gambling is very much part of the DNA of the country. While crypto sceptics accuse investing in blockchain currencies as nothing other than a gamble, online casinos make no pretence that they are any more than a great entertainment option. Just as it can be hard to find a reliable crypto exchange, online casinos can also be a bit hit-and-miss - particularly offshore ones and those that accept cryptocurrencies. Unfortunately, it can all be rather like the Wild West and it can be hard to work out which ones are reputable. Fortunately, while online casinos that accept crypto payments via PayPal might be a fairly recent phenomenon, services that rate and review online casinos are not. For example, Casino.org ranks the top PayPal casinos in Canada , so that players do not have to take a risk. They can just get on with the fun, whether they are using fiat or cryptocurrencies or possibly a mixture of the two. Ultimately, while you can use PayPal for all kinds of cryptocurrency transactions, it is not a crypto exchange. You can use the platform to buy cryptocurrencies and the platform is also making it easier to use it. It allows consumers to pay for purchases using Bitcoin , Ethereum and other supported currencies with a seamless checkout process. Customers select their preferred currency at checkout ‚Äì just as they would select a debit or credit card ‚Äì and PayPal does the rest. PayPal also offers consumers features such as price alerts and recurring purchases, allowing users to buy, hold, sell, and manage their crypto assets through the platform. It can also be used to transfer crypto to family and friends, whether they are PayPal users or not. As the world wakes up to the potential of cryptocurrencies, PayPal claims to be leading the charge by unlocking new opportunities for consumers and businesses alike. Disclaimer: This article is provided for informational purposes only. It is not offered or intended to be used as legal, tax, investment, financial, or other advice.

title: Off The Grid confidential letter sparks speculation around tokenomics
body: This is a segment from The Drop newsletter. To read full editions, subscribe . The shooter game Off The Grid has faced some disapproval ‚Äî and some praise ‚Äî over a purported confidential letter. The letter in question was reportedly emailed to Gunzilla Games‚Äô private investors in regard to its GUN token that became tradeable on Binance this week. GUN launched on Monday and hit a $68 million market cap within hours of launch, but that number has since fallen to $40 million. The letter references a SAFT, or a Simple Agreement for Future Tokens, that means investors gave the company money upfront for tokens at a later, future date. The copy-pasted text of the letter was posted on X yesterday by a crypto trader and got over 115,000 views in less than a day. The larger post also included the trader‚Äôs scathing criticism of the decision. We don‚Äôt know more about the specifics of the SAFT yet, though. The supposed text of that email also references a change to GUN‚Äôs vesting tokenomics ‚Äî and offers investors a chance for a refund if they don‚Äôt want to agree to the new terms. What exactly might these changes be? The trader who leaked the purported letter, Grail.eth, claims seed round investors were supposed to get 5% of their GUN tokens unlocked on launch day, while strategic round investors were supposed to see 2% of their tokens unlock on launch. According to the public GUN whitepaper, the strategic round is seeing 0% of tokens unlocked on launch. The Private A and B rounds have been granted the same. This means these groups‚Äô tokens won‚Äôt be unlocked for at least a year because their tokens have a 12-month cliff, with 18 months of vesting. Some traders on Twitter speculate that the changes may be in order to fund the token‚Äôs listing on Binance, though this has not been confirmed by Gunzilla or Binance. ‚ÄúWe do not charge listing fees to projects listing on Binance,‚Äù a Binance spokesperson tells Blockworks. ‚ÄúRegardless, deposits from project teams are refundable and designed to help protect users by ensuring that projects are serious about building their projects, keeping them alive and continuing to build after listing on Binance. The deposit also serves to help protect users in situations where projects harm them by failing to deliver on their commitments.‚Äù Others have criticized GUN‚Äôs tokenomics for allotting a significant amount to investors in the first place. But not everyone‚Äôs seeing these tokenomics in a negative light. I‚Äôm personally a fan of any project that makes investors wait longer to unlock their tokens. The ‚Äúdump on retail‚Äù price action isn‚Äôt fun for anyone, and it can kill excitement around a new project fast if it happens shortly after a token launches. ‚ÄúA rare instance where the project chooses its users over VCs,‚Äù wrote Ava Labs Marketing Lead Avery Bartlett in response to the post with the letter, while also admitting he understood the criticism around it (Gunzilla is using its own Avalanche L1). In a DM, Bartlett told Blockworks: ‚ÄúThe people I know didn‚Äôt get [a letter]. I got nodes on secondary and didn‚Äôt get it,‚Äù suggesting validator investors did not see a change to their tokenomics. Theodore Agranat, Gunzilla‚Äôs Director of Web3, told Blockworks he was ‚Äúnot sure‚Äù when asked about the letter‚Äôs legitimacy. ‚ÄúI do know that whatever letter was sent out had [a] confidentiality clause attached to it. So not sure,‚Äù he said, adding that he would speak with his team. Agranat‚Äôs response indicates a letter was sent confidentially ‚Äî we just don‚Äôt know with 100% certainty if this copy-pasted text matches it. When Blockworks reached out a day later to follow up regarding the letter, Agranat did not respond by time of publication. Blockworks has reached out to Gunzilla for additional comment. title: XRP Price to $27? Expert Predicts Exact Timeline for the Next Massive Surge
body: Crypto expert Egrag Crypto has again predicted that the XRP price could rally to as high as $27. The analyst has also revealed the exact timeline for when the altcoin could record this massive price surge. Expert Reveals Time For XRP Price To Hit $27 In an X post , Egrag Crypto asserted that the XRP price can hit $27 in 60 days. The expert remarked that historical patterns indicate that the altcoin can reach this target within this timeframe. Based on this price prediction, XRP could reach this $27 target by June, marking a 1,250% gain for Ripple‚Äôs native crypto. The expert‚Äôs accompanying chart showed that he was alluding to the 2017 bull run as to why the altcoin could record such a parabolic rally. In 2017, XRP recorded a historic gain of over 60,000% as it rallied to its current all-time high (ATH) of $3.8 the following year. As such, based on history, a 1,250% increase is nothing for the altcoin. In the meantime, the XRP price still boasts a bearish outlook thanks to the sentiment in the broader crypto market. As CoinGape reported, Ripple‚Äôs coin could drop to the next major support levels at $1.79 and $1.56 if it fails to hold above $2.03. Decision Time For The Altcoin In an X post, crypto analyst CasiTrades stated that it is decision time for the XRP price. She noted that the altcoin is showing strength with a bounce right back to the first key test at $2.17. She added that this is the resistance level she wants to see flip into support, as it might be the ‚Äúmost important price of the week.‚Äù The analyst stated that XRP must reclaim this level to build momentum. She added that the $2 level remains a valid target if the $2.17 level rejects. Meanwhile, CasiTrades revealed that $2.70, $3.05, and $3.80 are the major resistance zones once the upward trend is confirmed. The analyst also mentioned that the XRP price is now fully inside the Fibonacci Time Zone 3, which spans most of April. She affirmed that this is the breakout window market participants have been preparing for and that all signs point to a macro wave. CasiTrades affirmed that the structure is clean. The RSI divergence has confirmed the bottom, while the subwaves are aligning well with the larger targets. If the next leg pushes XRP back above $2.17 with momentum, she claimed that market participants may finally see obvious signs of Wave 3. Interestingly, the analyst added that if the altcoin clears $2.70 this week, it may break the $1,000 price extension. For now, investors may remain cautious, especially seeing how XRP fell after the PMI and JOLTS data release earlier today. Donald Trump is also set to announce reciprocal tariffs tomorrow, which could spark a massive price crash. The post XRP Price to $27? Expert Predicts Exact Timeline for the Next Massive Surge appeared first on CoinGape .

title: ‚ÄòWe can‚Äôt defeat an enemy that we don‚Äôt know‚Äô: Researcher warns of North Korea‚Äôs changing crypto tactics
body: Paradigm security researcher Samczsun is raising concerns that North Korea‚Äôs cyber operations extend far beyond the notorious Lazarus Group. His warnings come as the crypto industry emerges from the recent Bybit hack , which reportedly involved a sophisticated compromise of SafeWallet infrastructure. This attack marked a departure from previous North Korean hacking incidents . Instead of directly targeting Bybit, the hackers managed to breach Safe{Wallet}. This shift in tactics highlights the growing sophistication of their strategies and raises significant concerns about the security of the broader cryptocurrency ecosystem. According to Samczsun , North Korean-backed cybercrime isn‚Äôt just the work of a single group, but rather a network of state-sponsored threat actors operating under different names. You might also like: Trump family reportedly seizes majority control of World Liberty Financial North Korea‚Äôs cyber warfare structure Samczsun has been analyzing North Korea‚Äôs cyber threat for years. He explains that referring to all North Korean cyber activity as the ‚ÄúLazarus Group‚Äù oversimplifies a far more complex network. North Korea‚Äôs hacking operations are primarily run through the Reconnaissance General Bureau, an intelligence agency that oversees multiple hacking units. These include not only Lazarus Group but also APT38, AppleJeus, and other specialized teams. Each of these groups has a different focus. Lazarus Group, for example, is known for high-profile cyberattacks, including the 2014 Sony Pictures hack and the 2016 Bangladesh Bank heist. APT38 specializes in financial crimes, including bank fraud and cryptocurrency theft. ‚ÄúAPT38,‚Äù Samczsun wrote, ‚Äúwhich spun out of Lazarus Group in around 2016 in order to focus on financial crimes, targeting banks (such as the Bank of Bangladesh) first, then cryptocurrency later.‚Äù AppleJeus has targeted cryptocurrency users with malware disguised as trading apps. These groups work under the same government umbrella, helping to fund North Korea‚Äôs weapons programs and evade international sanctions. You might also like: Bitcoin in retirement plans? Sen. Tuberville revives crypto bill Crypto is now a North Korea target North Korea has turned to cryptocurrency as a major source of revenue. Unlike traditional finance, crypto transactions are decentralized and often more difficult to track or freeze. North Korean hackers exploit this by breaching exchanges, deploying malware, and using fake job offers to gain access to internal systems. One example is the case of ‚ÄúWagemole‚Äù operatives ‚Äî North Korean IT workers who infiltrate legitimate tech companies. These individuals appear to be regular employees but sometimes use their access to steal funds or compromise systems. This tactic was seen in the Munchables exploit , where an employee with ties to North Korea drained assets from the protocol. Another method is supply chain attacks, where hackers compromise software providers that serve cryptocurrency firms. In one case, AppleJeus hackers inserted malware into a widely used communications tool, affecting millions of users. In another, North Korean attackers breached a contractor working with Radiant Capital, gaining access through social engineering on Telegram, according to Samczsun. You might also like: Analysis: Bitcoin may see consolidation in April and May as selling pressure drops What this means for crypto Samczsun warned that North Korea‚Äôs cyber operations are evolving. The Bybit attack shows that hackers are now targeting infrastructure providers, not just exchanges. This means the entire crypto ecosystem ‚Äî from wallets to smart contract platforms ‚Äî could be at risk. For crypto users and businesses, the key takeaway is that North Korean cyber threats go beyond Lazarus Group and simple exchange hacks. The industry needs stronger security protocols, improved intelligence sharing, and greater awareness of social engineering threats.

title: Caution: Crypto Fear & Greed Index Unchanged at 34, Lingering in ‚ÄòFear‚Äô Zone
body: Are you feeling uneasy about the crypto market? You‚Äôre not alone. The latest Crypto Fear & Greed Index reading indicates that the market sentiment remains firmly in the ‚ÄòFear‚Äô zone. As of April 1st, the index, a crucial tool for gauging overall market emotions, sits at 34, unchanged from the previous day. This consistent ‚ÄòFear‚Äô reading prompts a deeper look into what this means for investors and the potential future of the crypto landscape. Decoding the Crypto Fear & Greed Index: A Sentiment Compass The Crypto Fear and Greed Index , developed by Alternative.me, acts like a compass for the volatile cryptocurrency market. It‚Äôs designed to distill the complex emotions driving crypto trading into a single, easy-to-understand number. Ranging from 0 (Extreme Fear) to 100 (Extreme Greed), the index provides a snapshot of the prevailing market sentiment. Think of it as a gauge of investor emotions ‚Äì are people panicking and selling, or are they enthusiastically buying? Currently, the needle is pointing towards ‚ÄòFear‚Äô. But what exactly fuels this index, and why is it important for anyone involved in the crypto space? Let‚Äôs break down the components: Volatility (25%): Measuring the rapid and unpredictable price swings in the crypto market. High volatility often correlates with fear, as uncertainty increases. Market Momentum/Volume (25%): Analyzing trading volume and market momentum against recent averages. Strong buying momentum can suggest greed, while weak volume during price drops can signal fear. Social Media (15%): Tracking sentiment across social media platforms, particularly crypto-focused channels. This factor assesses the overall buzz and positivity or negativity surrounding cryptocurrencies. Surveys (15%): Conducting periodic polls to directly gauge crypto investors‚Äô feelings and expectations. While not always real-time, surveys provide valuable insights into broader sentiment trends. Bitcoin Dominance (10%): Monitoring Bitcoin‚Äôs share of the total crypto market capitalization. Increased Bitcoin dominance can sometimes indicate a ‚Äòflight to safety‚Äô during fearful times, as investors move away from riskier altcoins. Google Trends (10%): Analyzing Google search queries related to Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies. Spikes in searches like ‚ÄúBitcoin crash‚Äù can reflect increased fear in the general public. Why Does the ‚ÄòFear Zone‚Äô Persist? Understanding Current Crypto Market Sentiment The persistent reading of 34, firmly within the Fear zone , highlights a prevailing cautiousness in the crypto market. Several factors could be contributing to this sustained sentiment. Global economic uncertainties, regulatory pressures, and recent market corrections can all fuel investor anxiety. When the index hovers in the ‚ÄòFear‚Äô zone, it suggests that investors are apprehensive, potentially leading to decreased buying pressure and increased selling pressure. This environment can create opportunities for savvy investors, but it also underscores the need for careful navigation. Is this prolonged ‚ÄòFear‚Äô a bad thing? Not necessarily. In fact, contrarian investors often see periods of extreme fear as potential buying opportunities. The logic is simple: when everyone else is fearful and selling, prices may be undervalued, presenting a chance to buy low before the market potentially recovers. Navigating Market Volatility and Bitcoin Sentiment in Times of Fear Market volatility is inherent to the cryptocurrency space, but understanding how to navigate it, especially during periods of fear, is crucial. The Bitcoin sentiment , often a bellwether for the broader crypto market, plays a significant role in the Fear & Greed Index. Bitcoin‚Äôs price movements and overall sentiment heavily influence the index due to its market dominance. When Bitcoin experiences volatility or negative sentiment, it often drags the entire market mood down with it. Here are a few actionable insights to consider when the Crypto Fear & Greed Index indicates ‚ÄòFear‚Äô: Do Your Own Research (DYOR): Never rely solely on market sentiment or fear. Conduct thorough research on projects before investing. Understand the fundamentals, technology, and long-term potential. Dollar-Cost Averaging (DCA): Consider DCA as a strategy during fearful times. Instead of trying to time the market bottom, invest a fixed amount at regular intervals. This can help mitigate risk and average out your entry price. Review Your Portfolio: Periods of fear are good times to reassess your portfolio. Are your holdings aligned with your risk tolerance and long-term investment goals? Consider rebalancing if necessary. Stay Informed, But Filter the Noise: Keep abreast of market news, but be wary of excessive hype or fear-mongering. Focus on credible sources and fundamental analysis rather than succumbing to emotional reactions. Long-Term Perspective: Remember that cryptocurrency markets are cyclical. Periods of fear are often followed by periods of growth. Maintain a long-term perspective and avoid making impulsive decisions based on short-term market fluctuations. The Silver Lining of Fear: Potential Opportunities in Crypto Market Sentiment While ‚ÄòFear‚Äô might sound negative, it‚Äôs essential to recognize that it can also present opportunities. As Warren Buffett famously said, ‚ÄúBe fearful when others are greedy, and greedy when others are fearful.‚Äù When the crypto market sentiment is dominated by fear, it can lead to price corrections and potentially undervalued assets. This is when diligent investors can find opportunities to accumulate quality cryptocurrencies at discounted prices. However, it‚Äôs crucial to differentiate between fear-driven dips and projects with genuinely weakened fundamentals. The Crypto Fear & Greed Index is not a crystal ball, but it‚Äôs a valuable tool for understanding the prevailing emotional climate of the crypto market. The current reading of 34, consistently in the ‚ÄòFear‚Äô zone, serves as a reminder of the cautious sentiment. By understanding the factors that influence this index and adopting a rational, research-driven approach, investors can navigate these periods of fear and potentially position themselves for future market upturns. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action.

title: M2 Money Supply vs. Global Liquidity: Don‚Äôt Get Mistaken!
body: The post M2 Money Supply vs. Global Liquidity: Don‚Äôt Get Mistaken! appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News The crypto market is always shifting based on global money trends, but a new debate is confusing traders. Meanwhile, popular analyst VirtualBacon recently pointed out a big issue, stating how different sources define M2 Money Supply and global liquidity , leading to mixed market signals. Some traders see bullish signs in the chart, while others don‚Äôt, and the reason comes down to how M2 is measured. Is M2 growing, or are some trackers mixing it with global liquidity? Bitcoin and M2 Money Supply For Bitcoin, M2 Money Supply growth is a key factor in price movements. M2 measures the available cash reserves, including cash deposits, deposits in checks, savings, market accounts, funds, and deposits of less than $100,000. Just found this inconsistency causing arguments on M2 vs global liquidity. On many trackers like Bitcoin Magazine Pro, Global M2 is calculated to include central bank balance sheets (AKA Global Liquidity). Whereas the traditional M2 money supply in only the cash reserve‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/z7afTmymwa ‚Äî VirtualBacon (@VirtualBacon0x) April 1, 2025 When M2 expands, more money is available to invest, and Bitcoin benefits as a liquidity-sensitive asset. A rise in M2 often leads to a surge in Bitcoin prices, as more investors pour money into digital assets. Global M2 liquidity is surging, and history suggests that risk assets like Bitcoin may soon react. As of April 1, global M2 money supply reached an all-time high of $108.4 trillion , marking a 3.7% increase from its 2025 low of $106 trillion recorded on nov 4. . Altcoins React To Global Liquidity Altcoins, on the other hand, are more influenced by global liquidity, which includes central bank balance sheets and overall risk investment trends. When global liquidity increases, investors become more willing to take risks, benefiting altcoins. This is why altcoins often see more volatility compared to Bitcoin. The broader net cast by global liquidity impacts risk assets, and altcoins dance to this rhythm. Things To Keep in Mind The important lesson for crypto traders is to understand which data matters for their investments. Bitcoin‚Äôs price is closely tied to M2 Money Supply, while altcoins respond more to global liquidity trends.

title: US Dollar Weakness Hinting at High Probability Setup for Bitcoin According to Real Vision Analyst ‚Äì Here‚Äôs When
body: Crypto analyst Jamie Coutts says that a breakdown in the US Dollar Index (DXY) could be hinting at coming rallies for Bitcoin ( BTC ). In a new interview on the Less Noise More Signal YouTube Channel, Coutts shares a chart that shows the price of Bitcoin overlaid with large down moves ‚Äì of at least 2.5% or more ‚Äì in the DXY. The DXY measures the strength of the USD against a basket of other major foreign currencies weighted by volume and often moves inversely to risk assets like Bitcoin. According to Coutts, many of the large downward moves in DXY ‚Äì like the one that happened in late March ‚Äì have coincided with the beginning of BTC rallies. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just showing the Bitcoin chart and when these have occurred, which are the yellow icons. And so, on the eight occasions set, we‚Äôve seen this play out 90 days later on all eight occasions ‚Äì the Bitcoin [price] has been higher on average by about 30%, but anywhere by about 30% to 50% or 60%. So if this was to play out and the lag between financial conditions and liquidity and asset prices plays out, then, really, we‚Äôre sort of looking at May as being a strong month for Bitcoin and potentially a retest of the all-time highs.‚Äù Source: Jamie Coutts/YouTube At time of writing, Bitcoin is trading at $85,138, 21% below its all-time high. title: A First! Brazilian Court Uses Blockchain Technology for Legal Notices in Bitcoin Scam Case!
body: A Brazilian court has authorized the use of non-fungible tokens (NFTs) to inform unknown Bitcoin owners of their involvement in a $900 million pyramid scheme allegedly linked to BWA Brazil. Brazilian Court Approves NFT-Based Subpoenas in Bitcoin Scam Case This legal move leverages blockchain technology to deliver direct legal notices to wallet addresses suspected of holding embezzled funds. The court-appointed receiver handling BWA Brazil‚Äôs bankruptcy proceedings filed a petition requesting approval for digital service of process via NFTs. The judge ruled in his favor, stating: ‚ÄúCreditors who have suffered millions of dollars in losses should not suffer further harm from regulatory delays in keeping up with technological innovation.‚Äù The ruling allows the court to mint NFTs containing legal documents and send them to wallet addresses associated with the scheme, even if their owners cannot be identified. The Public Prosecutor's Office supported the motion, emphasizing the importance of stopping the statute of limitations on claims regarding Bitcoin assets acquired using creditor funds. BWA Brazil‚Äôs Alleged Crypto Pyramid Scheme Founded in 2017 by Paulo Roberto Ramos Bilibio, BWA Brazil marketed itself as a Bitcoin investment firm, promising fixed monthly returns of 5%, an unrealistic figure given Bitcoin‚Äôs volatile nature. The firm froze withdrawals in early 2020, leaving investors with losses exceeding $52.2 million. The firm was first placed into legal rescue in July 2020, but its case was later upgraded to bankruptcy proceedings after customers were not compensated. Bilibio and his partner Jessica da Silva Farias allegedly used customer deposits to purchase Bitcoin, amassing an estimated 11,200 BTC, currently worth over $900 million. Both suspects remain at large. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: A First! Brazilian Court Uses Blockchain Technology for Legal Notices in Bitcoin Scam Case!

title: Urgent Crypto Alert: Trump‚Äôs Tariffs Announcement on April 2nd Sparks Market Jitters
body: Hold onto your hats, crypto enthusiasts! The markets are bracing for potential turbulence as U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent just dropped a bombshell: President Donald Trump is set to unveil detailed reciprocal tariffs on April 2nd at 19:00 UTC. This news, delivered in a Fox News interview and reported by Forexlive, has the potential to send ripples through the global economy, and the ever-sensitive crypto market is undoubtedly watching with bated breath. What does this mean for your digital assets? Let‚Äôs dive into the specifics and unpack the possible scenarios. Why Trump Tariffs are a Big Deal for the Crypto Market Trump tariffs , a hallmark of the former president‚Äôs trade policies, are essentially taxes imposed on imported goods. While seemingly straightforward, these measures can trigger a complex chain of reactions that extend far beyond traditional markets, directly impacting the digital asset space. Here‚Äôs why crypto investors should pay close attention: Market Volatility Amplification: Tariffs often lead to trade disputes and uncertainty in the global economy. This uncertainty translates directly into market volatility , something the crypto market is already intimately familiar with. When traditional markets react negatively to tariff announcements, we often see a corresponding, and sometimes amplified, reaction in the crypto sphere. Risk-Off Sentiment: Tariffs can fuel a ‚Äòrisk-off‚Äô sentiment among investors. In times of economic uncertainty, investors tend to flock to safer assets. While some argue Bitcoin is becoming a ‚Äòsafe haven‚Äô asset, the broader crypto market is still largely considered a high-risk, high-reward investment. A risk-off environment could lead to capital outflows from crypto to more traditional safe havens like gold or government bonds. Inflationary Pressures: Tariffs increase the cost of imported goods. These increased costs can be passed on to consumers, leading to inflationary pressures. Inflation can erode the purchasing power of fiat currencies, which, in theory, could make inflation-resistant assets like cryptocurrencies more attractive. However, the immediate market reaction to tariff news is often negative, driven by fear of economic disruption. Geopolitical Uncertainty: Global trade is a delicate web of interconnected economies. Tariffs can disrupt these relationships, leading to geopolitical tensions and further economic instability. This broader uncertainty can impact investor sentiment across all asset classes, including crypto. Decoding the Announcement: What to Expect on April 2nd Secretary Bessent‚Äôs announcement is brief but loaded with implications. The key phrase here is ‚Äúdetailed information on reciprocal tariffs.‚Äù Let‚Äôs break down what each part means: * **Detailed Information:** This suggests that Trump‚Äôs announcement won‚Äôt be a vague statement but will likely include specifics about which countries and goods will be targeted, and the percentage of the tariffs. The level of detail will heavily influence market reactions. Vague announcements create uncertainty, while detailed ones allow for more precise market assessments and responses. * **Reciprocal Tariffs:** ‚ÄúReciprocal‚Äù implies that these tariffs are in response to trade practices of other countries. This could escalate into a trade war if other nations retaliate with their own tariffs. Trade wars are generally bad news for global trade and market stability. * **April 2nd, 19:00 UTC:** Mark your calendars! This is the crucial time to watch for the announcement. Expect increased volatility in the crypto market around this time. News outlets and crypto analysis platforms will be closely monitoring and reporting on the announcement and its immediate market impact. Potential Impacts on Your Crypto Portfolio So, how might these Trump tariffs affect your crypto holdings? While predicting market movements with certainty is impossible, here are a few potential scenarios to consider: Scenario Potential Crypto Market Reaction Actionable Insight Aggressive Tariffs Announced (High tariffs on major trading partners) Negative. Sharp drop in crypto prices, increased volatility, potential risk-off flight to fiat or stablecoins. Consider risk management strategies: reduce exposure, set stop-loss orders, diversify into stablecoins temporarily. Moderate Tariffs Announced (Targeted tariffs, less broad impact) Neutral to Slightly Negative. Moderate volatility, potential short-term dip followed by recovery if the market assesses the impact as manageable. Monitor market sentiment closely, consider buying the dip if you believe in long-term crypto prospects. Announcement Delayed or Less Hawkish than Expected Positive to Neutral. Relief rally in crypto prices, reduced volatility. Market may interpret delay or softer stance as less immediate economic threat. Potential buying opportunity, but remain cautious as tariff issue is likely not fully resolved. Navigating the Uncertainty: Actionable Insights for Crypto Investors In the face of this urgent news, what should crypto investors do? Here are some actionable insights: * **Stay Informed:** Keep a close eye on news and market analysis leading up to and following the April 2nd announcement. Reputable crypto news sources and financial news outlets will be crucial. * **Manage Risk:** Volatility is expected. Implement risk management strategies appropriate for your risk tolerance. This might include adjusting your portfolio allocation, setting stop-loss orders, or hedging with stablecoins. * **Don‚Äôt Panic Sell:** Market dips can be unsettling, but panic selling often leads to losses. Make informed decisions based on your investment strategy and risk assessment, not emotional reactions. * **Long-Term Perspective:** Remember that the crypto market is known for its cyclical nature. Short-term volatility driven by tariff news may present buying opportunities for long-term investors who believe in the fundamental value of cryptocurrencies. * **Diversification:** A diversified portfolio across different asset classes, including and beyond crypto, can help mitigate risk during periods of economic uncertainty. The Crypto World Watches and Waits The upcoming announcement of Trump tariffs is a significant event that could inject further volatility into the already dynamic crypto market . While the exact impact remains to be seen, being prepared, staying informed, and managing risk are crucial for navigating these potentially turbulent waters. The crypto community will be keenly observing the events of April 2nd, ready to adapt to whatever unfolds in the ever-evolving landscape of global trade and finance. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping crypto market price action.

title: Hut 8 CEO on tie-up with Trump family: ‚Äòwe‚Äôll build this business together‚Äô
body: Hut 8 CEO Asher Genoot discussed in a Bloomberg interview the logic behind the newly launched American Bitcoin venture.
